messages.title: ECONOMIC CHAOS IF ED MILIBAND BECOMES PRIME MINISTER?
messages.content: "I'm afraid there is no money left" - Note from Liam Byrne MP, Labour Minister, May 2010

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Ed Miliband's Labour Party threatens our economic recovery, with the same mix of borrowing and tax rises as before.
Labour spending plans guarantee tax rises for families on low and middle incomes.
In Wales, where Labour already runs the NHS, patients wait longer than in England for treatment, at A&Es, for ambulances and for diagnostic tests.
Green spaces in Darlington replaced with council housing.
Even more of some of the highest council tax rises in England.

issues.economy: Ed Miliband's Labour Party threatens our economic recovery, with the same mix of borrowing and tax rises as before.
issues.environment: Green spaces in Darlington replaced with council housing.
issues.governance: Even more of some of the highest council tax rises in England.
issues.health: In Wales, where Labour already runs the NHS, patients wait longer than in England for treatment, at A&Es, for ambulances and for diagnostic tests.

housing.content: Green spaces in Darlington replaced with council housing.

quotes.text: I'm afraid there is no money left

images.caption: Promotional image opposing Ed Miliband as Prime Minister with quotes and policy critiques.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet appears to be from an opposing campaign critiquing Ed Miliband's potential as Prime Minister and Labour Party's policies.
